result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Carlos L Sanchez

records.addlTxt:
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.
Attorney Lauren Avery Blumenthal in court.  Grace M. Gall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Parties requested a plea and sentencing date. Court scheduled plea and sentencing hearing date. Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion for Bail Reduction.  (Carlos L. Sanchez - #2022005208, House of Correction, 8885 S 68th St, Franklin WI 53132).
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion for Bail Reduction.  (Carlos L. Sanchez - #2022005208, House of Correction, 8885 S 68th St, Franklin WI 53132).

Attorney Lauren Avery Blumenthal in court, defendant Carlos L Sanchez not in court, in custody.  Grace M. Gall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for a scheduling conference.  Defense requests a status date.  Court set the matter as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Status conference scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Carlos L Sanchez in court, appear by video with attorney Lauren Avery Blumenthal, appear by video.  Defendant Carlos L Sanchez in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 40, Judge Shelton. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Lauren Avery Blumenthal in court by video, defendant Carlos L Sanchez not in court, in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for preliminary hearing. State witness present. Attorney Lauren Avery Blimenthal needs more time to meet with client. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 045407,
Payable Number: 1006107,
Receipt Number: 22RP019217,
Amount: $20.00

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.   If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, bail to revert to $50,000.00 .  If alternative bail is paid, Defendant to be released and placed on Electronic Monitoring waiting list. Electronic monitoring will be 24 hour curfew except for court appearances.
  Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.
  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  No possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription.

No Contact Order signed and filed.

Defendant Carlos L Sanchez in court with attorney Lauren Avery Blumenthal.  Defendant Carlos L Sanchez in custody.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
